answerText: octahedral[10] The substitution of six ammonia ligands for six water ligands causes a cobalt(II) complex to change color from pink to orange because ammonia ligands create a larger splitting in energy of these atomic orbitals, which hold ten electrons.
heading: MUT |2012 | 2 | 7 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Name the following from the exciting field of cobalt coordination chemistry, for 10 points each: [10] Complexes of cobalt(III) tend to exhibit this geometry in which the central ion forms six coordination bonds with its ligands. Sulfur hexafluoride also has this geometry.
